
A careless admin leaked part of the RSA private key. Can you exploit the partial exposure to recover the message encrypted as 9621529405840312343218156337638565777229246677925324969759043841265871903877741922325490872003895218259482865429669662832893967716117449344816988832374721?


The flag format is flag{...}
n=10034072179516404426393299310317410988298052784051857590526324510147010199585292938227165438919459230126513395610170234470644277930945429673305876332541037, e=8314517902976027192358987170453696289422083326077070422308954263887205049710252740134588267611551167897135709755166122319092078231063410781485921232864843, partial_p=15230254294250472694

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{du8q3835}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 9621529405840312343218156337638565777229246677925324969759043841265871903877741922325490872003895218259482865429669662832893967716117449344816988832374721
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=10034072179516404426393299310317410988298052784051857590526324510147010199585292938227165438919459230126513395610170234470644277930945429673305876332541037, e=8314517902976027192358987170453696289422083326077070422308954263887205049710252740134588267611551167897135709755166122319092078231063410781485921232864843, partial_p=15230254294250472694
extra_info: p=95601855660820089039811106521116105380274100737268297444874542411048350019703, q=104956876727536215714248840587671623602241305633934130625555922740074964811579, Ï†(n)=10034072179516404426393299310317410988298052784051857590526324510147010199585092379494777082614705170179404607881187719064273075502874999208154753017709756
subtype: partial_key_exposure
